content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
─────────────────────────────
### Shared Smelting Furnaces Automation Network
Consists of:
• Two stone furnaces – one at Position(x=0.0, y=0.0) and another at Position(x=5.0, y=0.0) – each paired with nearby burner inserters and output chests; interconnecting transport belts ensure efficient smelting operations.

### Iron Ore Mining Automation Setup
Consists of:
• A burner mining drill at Position(x=-15.0, y=-50.0) with associated burner inserters and a wooden chest (e.g. at Position(x=-13.5, y=-51.5)); transport belt links convey the mined ore.

### Automation Research Lab
Consists of:
• A lab building receiving automation-science-pack inputs (currently in a no-power state) and a supporting electricity network formed by small electric poles that interconnect the lab with power sources.

### Water Supply System for Power Generation with Updated Steam Engine Placement
Consists of:
• A boiler at Position(x=8.0, y=20.5) with connection points at Position(x=8.5, y=18.5) and Position(x=8.5, y=22.5); its fluid box holds 200 units of water at 15° C.
• Pre‐existing steam engines positioned at:
  – Position(x=1.5, y=13.5)
  – Position(x=13.5, y=14.5)
  – Position(x=19.5, y=14.5)
  – Position(x=13.5, y=17.5)
  – Position(x=17.5, y=20.5)
  – Position(x=11.5, y=20.5)
(All report a NOT_CONNECTED status with warnings such as “not connected to power network”, “no input liquid”, and “no fluid present in connections”.)
• An offshore pump at Position(x=0.5, y=30.5) supplies water.
• Multiple pipe groups interconnect these entities.
• Recent operations attempted to reposition a newly crafted steam engine closer to the boiler for improved pipe integration. Candidate placement coordinates near Position(x=8.0, y=19.0), Position(x=8.5, y=17.5), and Position(x=9.0, y=19.0) were tested but obstructions and buildability issues prevented successful placement. Subsequent reclamation and recrafting efforts – including additional smelting operations to address ingredient shortages – have been initiated to resolve this integration challenge.

ERROR TIPS
────────────
• Steam Engine Crafting and Inventory Shortfalls
 – Verify that all required sub-ingredients (e.g. iron-plate needed for iron-gear-wheels) are sufficiently available prior to initiating a craft command.
 – Monitor inventory after extraction and crafting operations to ensure a steam engine is present before attempting repositioning.

• Placement and Repositioning Obstacles
 – Confirm that candidate coordinates are clear and buildable prior to placement; use API checks to validate clearance.
 – After reclaiming a placed engine, validate its presence in the inventory before attempting repositioning; adjust coordinates if persistent obstructions are detected.

• Furnace Operation and Resource Management
 – Ensure furnaces have both adequate fuel (such as coal) and necessary raw ingredients (like iron-ore) to sustain continuous smelting.
 – Conduct resource level checks before initiating smelting to prevent delays caused by insufficient outputs needed for crafting.

No custom functions have been defined by the agent in the current execution steps.
